Dear {{candidate_name}},

Sub: Your Appointment as “{{designation}}”.

With reference to your application and subsequent interview you had with us, we are pleased to appoint you as {{designation}} with Leister Technologies India Pvt. Ltd. You will be based at {{location}} and you shall be reporting to {{reporting_name}}, {{reporting_title}} with effect from {{doj}} on the following terms and conditions:

  1. Compensation Package:

Your annual gross compensation package will be {{ctc_amount}} ({{ctc_in_words}}). The break-up of your compensation is as per the enclosed Annexure-I.

Notwithstanding anything contained in this offer, the Employee shall be entitled to bonus/ rewards/ incentives only upon satisfaction of the annual objectives of the Company as set out periodically in mutual consultation. Any such payment would depend on the performance of the Employee and that of the Company and will be entirely at the discretion of management.

If the Company makes an overpayment which you are not entitled / is more than that entitled, the Company has the right to recover the overpayment by deductions from your salary or other payments due. Any deductions will normally be made over the same period that the overpayment was made. It is in your interest to regularly check your pay slips. You will be paid monthly in arrears to a bank account of your choice.

  1. Performance Appraisal/ Increment:

Performance Appraisal process is carried out annually during the month of January by your immediate supervisor. Annual increments in your salary are not automatic and will be at the discretion of the Management based on the outcome of your performance appraisal outcomes. Your increment in grade is discretionary and will be subject to, and on the basis of, effective performance and results during the period. The Employee shall not be eligible for the Performance-based Incentive if he/she leaves the job without completing the calendar year.

  1. Retirement Benefits:

Provident Fund: You will be entitled to Provident Fund as per the prevailing EPFO Scheme. The Company will deduct from salary, your share of contribution on a monthly basis in accordance with the law. An equal amount of contribution from the employer will be deposited monthly with the Employee’s Provident Fund Scheme, the details of which you may check online from time to time.

Gratuity: Gratuity shall be paid to eligible employees in accordance with the applicable law.

  1. Working Hours:

Employee has been informed about the working hours of the organization as indicated in the Employee Handbook. The Employee may have to attend work before and/or after regular office hours as well as on holidays or while on vacation, as the exigencies of work may demand.

  1. Leave:

You will be entitled to privilege, sick and casual leaves in accordance with the Company’s Leave Policy currently in force and as amended from time to time. If, however, you are governed by the Employees’ State Insurance Act 1948, sick leave entitlements will be as per the ESI Act.

  1. Dress Code:

You shall comply with Company dress regulations laid out in the Company’s Employee Handbook and in case you do not comply by the same it shall be construed as a violation of the rules of employment under disciplinary grounds.

  1. Probation:

You shall be on probation for a period of six months from the date of joining. If the management is not satisfied with your work and/or conduct, your services shall be liable to termination with one month’s notice or salary in lieu thereof at any time during the probationary period. Similarly, you shall be entitled to resign from the services of the Company by giving one month’s notice or salary in lieu thereof during probationary period. This period of probation will be liable to such extension(s) as the management may deem fit. Unless an order in writing confirming you is given, you will continue to be on probation.

  1. Transfer:

You will be liable to be transferred/ deputed, depending upon the exigencies of work, from one work area/ section/ department/ job to another work area/ section/ department/ job or to another unit of the company or a sister unit/ group company anywhere in India or abroad where the company may have its business and in such an event be governed by the terms & conditions of service applicable at that department/ section/ unit/ establishment/ company, subject to the condition that your pay and emoluments are not adversely affected.

  1. Responsibilities & Duties:

Your work in the organization will be subject to the rules and regulations of the Organization as laid down in relations to conduct, discipline and other matters. You will always be alive to the responsibilities and duties attached to your office and conduct yourself accordingly. You must effectively perform your role to ensure results and you will be expected to work extra hours to achieve this whenever the job requires.

  1. Travel:

The Employee’s job would require him/her to travel frequently out of office and travel to various cities/ regions/ areas as and when required and quite often at very short notice. The Employee should be prepared and fit to do so as per the Travel Policy of the Company and shall not raise objections. All traveling, and business-related expenses would be reimbursed to you as per Company Policy. However, Employee would neither be paid any extra allowance nor pocket money for this.

  1. Salary Confidentiality:

The pay and emoluments payable to you would be a matter of confidence between the management and yourself. As such you shall not divulge your pay and emoluments to anyone inside nor outside the organization nor shall you quote anybody else’s pay and emoluments to make a representation for yourself.

  1. Confidential Information:

You will not, at any time, without the consent in writing of the Company, during the term of your service with the Company or after the term of service by notice, disclose, divulge or make public any information regarding the Company’s products, operations, strategies, inventions, discoveries or improvements or business methods, or internal systems and procedures, transactions, finances or affairs of the Company. You must not at any time misappropriate files or documents of any kind belonging to the Company, or make copies, duplicates or excerpts for private or any other purpose unrelated to your employment.

  1. Protection of Interest:

Any inventions, discoveries, technical writings, designs or business methods conceived or made by you, individually or jointly, during your employment with the Company, whether patentable or unpatentable, or registerable or copyrighted material or trademarks, shall be promptly and fully disclosed and shall become the absolute property of the Company.

If you or any of your family members have financial/ gainful interest in any business firm and such a firm proposes to do business with Leister Technologies India Pvt. Ltd., then it would be obligatory on your part to make a written declaration to this effect to the Management before any business deal is entered into.

  1. Employment:

Your position is a whole-time employment with the Company, and you shall devote yourself exclusively to the furtherance of the business of the Company and to continually develop your professional skills in your own and the Company’s mutual interest. You will not take up any other work for remuneration (part time or otherwise) or work in an advisory capacity or be interested directly or indirectly (except as share or debenture holder) in any other trade or business during your employment with the Company without permission in writing from the Managing Director of the Company.

  1. Retirement:

The age of retirement of an employee from the services of the Company is 60 years. The date of retirement will be the last working day of the calendar month in which you attain the age of 60 years.

Your date of birth as recorded by the Company on the basis of documentary evidence submitted by you at the time of your appointment is {{doj}}. Please note that this date will be considered for all purposes throughout your service with the Company.

  1. Past Records:

If any declaration given or information furnished by you to the Company proves to be false or if you are found to have willfully suppressed any material information, in such cases your services could be terminated without notice.

  1. Termination:

On confirmation the Company will be entitled to terminate your services by giving 1 month’s notice in writing or by payment of 1 month’s salary in lieu of such notice. In the event you desire to leave the services of the Company, you will give to the Company 1 month’s notice in writing or salary in lieu thereof. Your resignation shall not be effective unless accepted. The Management has the right to insist you to work for the entire notice period if it feels that it is in the interest of the Company and the current assignment. You shall not be entitled to adjust your pending earned leave with the notice period unless permitted by the Company.

If at any time, you, by your conduct, render yourself incompetent to perform your duties, (such incompetence to be determined by the company), or if you be dishonest, intemperate, irregular in attendance at work or otherwise misconduct yourself or commit any breach of these terms or the stipulations herein contained on your part, the Company may terminate your employment forthwith without any notice and may deduct from any salary then due to you such sums as in the opinion of the Company may be equivalent to any loss the Company may have sustained in consequence of your acts.

Upon termination of Employment, the Employee shall not work for companies, organizations or such other persons that are in direct or indirect competition with business of the Company for a period of 12 months. Upon contravention of this clause, the Employee agrees to pay to the Company a compensation equal to his total income (salary and other benefits) for last 12 months prior to termination of his employment with the Company. Such compensation shall become due and payable on the date of contravention.

  1. Abandonment of Services:

If you abscond yourself from duty without intimation or notice of absence for more than seven consecutive days, it will be deemed that you have voluntarily abandoned service and your name will be removed from the rolls of the Company.

  1. After Termination:

On termination of the employment contract, you will be required to hand over all Company property in your possession to your immediate supervisor and obtain necessary clearance. On production of such clearance alone will your dues, if any, be settled by the Company.

  1. Address:

You shall provide your residential address to the Management. Any communication sent on that address through UPC/ Registered A.D. shall be considered to be sufficiently served on you for all purpose. Any change in address should be communicated in writing and unless done so, the address in the records of the Company shall be treated as your residential address.

  1. Set Off:

The Company reserves its right to make adjustment and/ or to deduct any amount from the Employee’s salary and/or other dues payable to the Employee in case the Company suffers any loss on account of financial irregularities committed by the Employee.

  1. Indemnity:

The Employee shall indemnify the Company against any claims by third parties or losses suffered by the Company as a direct consequence of the Employee’s misconduct, indiscipline or misdemeanor or because of his neglect for his duties as detailed under the terms and conditions of his employment or careless execution of his responsibilities or where Employee acts in breach of his obligations under this Agreement.

  1. General Terms and Conditions:

The Employee shall not at any time make any untrue or misleading statement in relation to the Company. After the expiry or the termination of the Employee’s employment hereunder, the Employee shall not represent himself as being directly or indirectly employed by or connected with the Company. The Employee undertakes further that he shall not contact or liaise with or solicit the services and/or expertise of any of the employees of the Company after termination of his employment with the Company.

The Company considers punctuality and discipline as a very desirable and crucial attribute for all its Employees and as such, you are requested to be punctual, committed and sincere in attending to your duties.

This letter of appointment is subject to your being found medically fit by the Company’s suggested Medical Practitioner or such other Medical Officer that the Company may appoint for the purpose.

You will in all respects, be governed by the rules and regulations applicable from time to time to your category of employees. Access to all Employee Handbooks, policies and procedures etc. is available through your line manager or the HR Department, and copies can be provided on request.

  1. Entire Agreement:

This Agreement/ Offer supersedes all other agreements, oral or in writing, express or implied, between the Parties with respect to Employee’s employment with the Company. No other agreement, statement, inducement, covenant, or promise not contained in this Agreement/ Offer shall be valid or binding between the Parties. Management reserves all the rights to amend any of the above rules at its sole discretion.

  1. Dispute Resolution:

Any dispute or differences with reference to the interpretation of this Agreement/ Offer or other service terms and conditions arising out of this Agreement/ Offer shall be settled in good faith between the Parties hereto, failing which the same shall be referred to arbitration under the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 (and amendments). All hearings will take place in Chennai in English and Chennai Courts alone will have jurisdiction.

We congratulate you on your appointment and wish you a long and successful career with us. We are confident that your contribution will take us further in our journey towards becoming world leaders. We assure you of our support for your professional development and growth.

Employee’s team leader/ immediate supervisor would define your KRAs, objectives and Job responsibilities in due course of time.

Please return the duplicate copy of this letter of appointment duly signed in token of your having accepted the appointment. This letter of appointment is not valid till such time you have submitted your relieving letter from your previous employer.

Kindly submit clearance from your previous employer, copies of education/ experience certificate and three recent passport size photographs with the HR Department.

Welcoming you to this Organization and wishing you a successful career.

Yours sincerely,

For Leister Technologies India Pvt Ltd,

Mr. Rajesh Raghavan
Managing Director

*Please note – Bonus/Incentive will be paid annually during March.

Apart from the above you will be provided with Group Health Insurance and Group Personal Accident policy as per company policy.
